definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: And let there be no mistake: The blood is definitely running right now on Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 毋庸贅言，現在華爾街的確已經是血流成河了。

sentences.english: Can stand back and take the road, the blood become river and even so.
sentences.chinese: 可回頭觀望來時的路，血流成河，縱使如此。

sentences.english: The blood is definitely running right now on Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 毋庸贅言，現在華爾街的確已經是血流成河了。

definition: enough blood flowing to float pestles (idiom); rivers of blood/blood bath
people are in a terrible situation (idiom)
flesh and blood flying (idiom); carnage/people blown to pieces
to massacre everyone in a captured city
hell on earth (idiom); suffering the torments of Buddhist hell while still alive/fig. having an uncomfortable time
fire beacons on all sides (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
lit. plaintive whine of geese (idiom); fig. land swarming with disaster victims/starving people fill the land
to die tragically/to meet with a violent death
